node.title: Notable Deaths 2021: Books
node.description: Remembering Larry McMurtry, Beverly Cleary, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Janet Malcolm, Charles W. Mills, Hans Küng and many others who died this year.

node.title: Proceeds From Rare Treasures Sold at Auction Help Steady Jewish History Museum
node.description: In June, Stuart Weitzman sold one-of-a-kind collectibles through Sotheby’s. Now, he’s using the proceeds to secure the National Museum of American Jewish History in Philadelphia.

node.title: How the Politics of Abortion Are Poised to Intensify
node.description: The anti-abortion and abortion rights movements are already beginning to mobilize for a new, deeply unsettled post-Roe political reality.

node.title: U.S. Hits Belarus With Sanctions Over Repression, Human Rights Violations of Migrants
node.description: The U.S., U.K., Canada and European Union hit Belarus with sanctions including travel bans and asset freezes on all suspected of aiding in the migrant crisis.

node.title: WTA Partner Backs League After Pulling Tournaments From China Over Peng Shuai Controversy
node.description: The show of support comes two days after WTA Chairman and CEO Steve Simon announced he was suspending all tournaments in China.

node.title: Woman Records Starbucks Barista Who Dropped Her Change, Dividing Internet
node.description: "If my change was thrown on the ground in front of me I'd have something to say, too," said one commenter.

node.title: Victoria records 1,188 new COVID-19 cases and 11 deaths
node.description: There are now 12,913 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 538 people have died during the current Delta outbreak.

node.title: A-League Women's season promises fresh start for Australian women's game.
node.description: After a season remembered more for bungles than brilliance, the new A-League Women's competition is hoping to spark a new era for the women's game, writes Samantha Lewis.

node.title: 'Bureaucratic overlords': SA senator Alex Antic speaks out after being taken to medi-hotel to quarantine
node.description: Liberal senator Alex Antic is taken to a medi-hotel after arriving from Canberra a week after Prime Minister Scott Morrison said he was fully vaccinated.

node.title: Record low number of sheep measles cases detected
node.description: The disease, which can pass to sheep via tapeworm eggs spread through dog faeces, is being well managed thanks to on-farm controls.

node.title: Jaune Quick-to-See Smith Maps New Meanings
node.description: At 81, the artist is still making clever and cutting work that juxtaposes symbols of American empire with those of Native culture.

node.title: The Knicks’ Struggles Go Deeper Than Kemba Walker
node.description: A surprising reconsideration of the lineup that pushed Walker out of the rotation could help with some of the team’s issues, but not all of them.

node.title: Police Arrest Suspect in Fatal Shooting of Beverly Hills Philanthropist
node.description: About an hour after Jacqueline Avant was killed, the police arrested a man after he accidentally shot himself in the foot while burglarizing a home in Hollywood.

node.title: NC Gov. Vetoes Bill Barring Mail-In Ballots From Being Counted After Election Day
node.description: Envelopes postmarked by the day of the primary or general election are counted if received within a three-day grace period, according to current law.

node.title: Taylor Swift Fan Defends Singer in Hilarious Discussion With Dentist Post Surgery
node.description: "I can't believe I allowed you to perform on me," the TikToker says in the now viral video.

node.title: Local councils fund report on land use issues
node.description: Local councils concerned that too much productive farmland is being converted to forestry are funding a report which they hope will show a way forward.

node.title: Scientists choose cryopreservation to store plant material for decades
node.description: Some of New Zealand's native plants are undergoing cryopreservation freezing as scientists explore conservation techniques that could protect at-risk species for future generations.

node.title: Traffic light system: Councils work out access to venues
node.description: Councils around the country have been making decisions on requirements to access their facilities, whether in red or orange traffic light settings. Audio

node.title: Second and third U.S. cases of Omicron COVID-19 diagnosed
node.description: One case involves a man who traveled to New York City for a convention attended by over 50,000.

node.title: Leonardo DiCaprio and Sean Penn Party at Art Basel
node.description: Loewe took over Twist, Superblue held a concert and CORE auctioned off art.

node.title: He Helped St. Louis Land the Rams. He Squeezed the N.F.L. When They Left.
node.description: How an N.F.L. insider turned into St. Louis’s best weapon against the league in the battle over the Rams’ relocation.

node.title: Why Didn’t the U.S. Detect Omicron Cases Sooner?
node.description: Genomic surveillance has improved enormously in recent months, but the system has built-in delays, and blind spots remain.

node.title: Blinken Trades Warnings With Russia’s Lavrov Over Ukraine, NATO
node.description: The secretary of state said that President Biden is ‘likely’ to speak soon with Russian President Vladimir V. Putin.

node.title: Woman Arrested After Allegedly Pointing Gun at Infant in Viral Photo
node.description: According to police, the suspect pulled out her gun during an argument over a parking space in the parking lot of a local grocery store.

node.title: Armed Man at United Nations Sought to Bring Medical Papers, Documents to Building, NYPD Says
node.description: NYPD First Deputy Commissioner Benjamin Tucker said that the documents "didn't have any specific meaning," but noted that detectives are still investigating the incident.

node.title: Firefighters Rescued Dangling Workers From Broken Scaffold 70 Feet Above Ground
node.description: After the scaffold broke, two construction workers found themselves stuck between the fifth and sixth floors before firefighters rescued them.

node.title: Ex-Staffer Says Epstein, Maxwell Told Him to 'Say Nothing' to Others About Their Lives
node.description: A former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein testified seeing young girls at his employer's house and says he helped picked some of them up from their homes.

node.title: COVID-19 has pushed an extra 1.1 million Indonesians into poverty. So could Australian farmers help?
node.description: More than 27 million Indonesians are in poverty but allowing more Australian food into the country could see fewer go hungry, and demand for food in Indonesia is expected to quadruple by 2050.

node.title: 'We're the canary in the coal mine': Farmers and miners are joining the discussion about climate change
node.description: Farmers and miners join a psychology researcher's campaign to engage in the debate over climate change and the plan to reach net-zero emissions by 2050.

node.title: How the absence of two NBA All Stars helped spark Patty Mills's career year
node.description: Fresh off a starring role in the Boomers' Olympic bronze medal campaign, Patty Mills is averaging career highs all over the place this NBA season. Here's how The Don award winner has done it.
